file_content.text: Ground to support team. I found our missing people; checking for survivors.
My lord. I'm so sorry.
Commander. I'm sorry.
Sir. I'm sorry.
The Archon... he had machines... he put a tube in my head....
He knows we saved the planet. Son of a sow's going to tell the Hutts.
Where did he go? We need to stop the Archon from getting a message offworld.
We have to find the Archon.
I failed, but I'm not stupid. This way.
Hold still. It's not your fault; no one can stand up under that kind of interrogation.
You did the best you could.
Shut up and follow me.
You should have stuck with labeling packages at the Ministry of Logistics. You have no place under my command.
Then you truly are a failure.
Maybe I never did. But I watched the Archon very carefully.
I have three hundred men waiting for shuttles. You promised time to evacuate.
You have been paid. That alone should still your simian tongue.
Besides, Makeb is not exploding, and I now have proof. Prepare to attack all Imperial positions; once the atmospheric interference clears, I will alert the fleet.
Szajin, Archon of the Hutt Cartel. You have escaped my grasp for too long.
I have you now, Hutt.
Ah, the Wrath of the Emperor's rotting corpse. You made a valiant effort.
You stand in the presence of a lord of the Dark Council. Perhaps you should show your respect?
We meet at last, Hutt.
Dark Council member for a day, and lord of a dying civilization. I show you more than you deserve.
Szajin the Archon. Spymaster of the Hutt Cartel. It's a pleasure to finally meet you.
Face-to-face at last.
And you. How I wish I could peel your mind; you do your kind proud.
Not bad. Tasteful, as Hutt palaces go.
Nice place you've got here.
My interests are more... ethereal than Karagga's.
My interests are more... ethereal than Nem'ro's.
Your dedication to your employer is admirable. Saving a planet when you were hired... what, as a thief?
Congratulations, Archon. Now you know--the Empire did what the Hutt Cartel couldn't, and Makeb is safe from disaster.
You figured out the truth.
I'd suspected, but the last pieces locked into place when your servants lay on my operating tables.
Archon! You attacked my people. You tortured them. Did you think I wouldn't find you?
You hurt my team.
By no means. Invading Stronghold One, seizing the laser drills to save Makeb... from the start, you have impressed me.
Alas, it is the Hutt Empire that will receive Makeb's bounty. My people will no longer be mocked as we are envied. We will not be criminals... but kings.
A galaxy run by Hutts... you really think that could happen?
You believe Hutts can rule?
Millennia ago, we were idolized by the younger species. We brought a golden age to a million worlds.
Some of us treasure the memories of that time. I will make them memories no longer.
The Empire has worked with the Hutt Cartel before. Why not work together again?
We can still negotiate.
Because the destiny of Hutts is not to trade and scheme. It never was, no matter how far we fell.
In ages past, the Hutt Archons were warriors and judges, exemplars of my people's strength.
Observe, all of you. You will see a Hutt battle as few have for ten thousand years!
You feel those tremors? If you believe Makeb is safe from disaster, you must be mad.
Deluded fool. Makeb is doomed.
Archon?
Perhaps we can negotiate.
If I were mad, you wouldn't be so desperately trying to stop me.
Your people are worms. They always will be.
Not interested. [Attack]
You call yourselves men of war? Observe, and see what an Archon of the old Hutt Empire can do!
The droids are pulling back. Secure the platform, and we'll send in the engineers.
Not enough skyfighters left to be a problem. Platform's all yours.
That should do it. Clear us a path to the platform, and I'll send out the last crew.
Are we all here? With your permission, my lord, we'll start the briefing.
Are we all here? Sir, we'll start the briefing at your command.
After vigorous discussion, the Science Bureau has reached consensus on a plan to preserve Makeb.
The isotope-5 deposits in Makeb's core generate powerful gravitational and electromagnetic fields. Until recently, those fields maintained the core's equilibrium.
The, ah, rapid removal of isotope-5 caused the fields to fluctuate and destabilized the core. Now Makeb is tearing itself apart.
It is now too late to reverse the destabilization process. Our only option is to accelerate it.
You have my attention, Nadrin. Why do we want to accelerate the planet's destruction?
How will that help?
You're proposing to destroy the planet, not save it. Are you admitting failure?
That's not what I asked for.
Not precisely, no. Please consider?
[Remain silent]
By forcing Makeb through the end stages of destabilization in a compressed time frame, the damage will be contained.
There won't be time for the mantle to fully crack before the core settles into a new state of equilibrium.
The acceleration won't be easy on the planet. The groundquakes will be worse than ever, and the aftershocks will continue for months.
The mesas will disintegrate, the cities will burn, and the gasses released will likely poison the atmosphere. But it's that or total annihilation.
You'll see a new Makeb, and when it's over, the isotope-5 will be intact and ready for harvest.
It's a dangerous plan, but it's all we have. Let's proceed.
Very well. I approve.
We're condemning this world's people. They may evacuate in time, but they'll never be able to return.
What about Makeb's citizens?
They'll have a memorial, which is more than the Hutts offered.
If all this works and we don't die horribly... if we still can't mine the isotope, then it was all for nothing.
Be sure about this.
My team is working on guidelines for future mining operations. We'll need to be careful, but the task is manageable.
May I? As we discussed earlier, the mining lasers are the key to manipulating the core. Our new engineers will operate the platforms.
The timing's perfect. The whole population is fleeing the planet, so that'll get rid of the Hutts while we work.
But the Archon still thinks we're trying to mine the isotope. He's sent his forces to blockade the laser drill platforms. All his forces.
The enemy is making a stand. What sort of opposition am I facing?
Give me your analysis.
The Archon and his people wouldn't go down with the planet. Why are they still here?
Why isn't he evacuating?
I can't speak for the Archon, but he's offered his men a bonus and promised to keep shuttles waiting.
This isn't the first time he's interfered. What if he knows we're trying to save the planet?
He may suspect the truth.
In that case, he'll convince the other Hutts to halt the evacuation.
We'll keep an ear out on the Hutts' communications--should tell us something.
You'll want to scatter the Archon's armies around three drill sites so our engineering teams can move in.
We've spotted isotope-5 droids advancing on the nearest platform--programmed to target you personally, according to intercepts. I'd take it as a compliment.
The Archon has declared war. I am an army, and I will triumph.
I will march to battle.
Targeting a Dark Council member is a declaration of war. Not that it will save the Archon.
Bold, but futile.
Whatever the Archon may think, he has no idea what I'm capable of. I'll take care of the droids.
They aren't prepared for me.
I've been hunted by Jedi, Sith and everything in between. A Hutt and his droids are chump change.
I've been targeted by worse.
You said the droids are at the first platform. Not the others?
What about the other drills?
There are massive life readings around the second and third, but no hard data. I'll update you when I know more.
Leave the isotope-5 droids to me. But there is no margin for error--ensure that everything goes according to plan.
Make sure you don't mess up.
I pledged my life to you before. I'd do it again in a heartbeat.
Engineering teams, prepare to move out!
For the Empire!
Lord Cytharat would've had tactical advice, but all I can say is, kill the rotters.
Special Energy Project Center? You have input?
We finished the software for the laser drills. It should mean greater precision, but we've never worked with Makeb hardware, so....
Attention, everyone! Briefing begins now!
Mighty and fearsome lord. I am pleased to state that your experiment proved fruitful.
Esteemed commander. I am pleased to state that your experiment proved fruitful.
Research continues, but we believe we can stabilize Makeb's core by using the planet's mining lasers to reshape the isotope-5 deposits.
How much more research before you're sure? And what do you need from me?
What's our next step, then?
We continue to finalize details. However, we will require a crew capable of controlling multiple mining platforms.
These mining lasers--we're standing on one now, correct? They create the drill shafts?
Tell me about the lasers.
Correct. The lasers drill down, and gravity funnels draw minerals up. Makeb's standard protocol.
This is for burying me. [Hurt him]
That experiment almost trapped me underground. Don't force me to replace you.
I... will endeavor to prove my worth, limited though it may be.
They're still figuring out the details, but it looks like we'll need to fully crew a couple of mining platforms.
That is an accurate assessment.
Problem is, our team can barely operate these wretched things. We need experts--engineers and supervisors who can run the mining lasers under our command.
The people of Makeb know this machinery better than anyone. Where do we find workers?
We'll need to recruit locals.
That's the trouble. Watch:
How difficult would it be to get a ship of Imperial engineers to Makeb?
Can we land more people?
Not practical in the time we have. Local workers are possible, but it gets tricky:
You're telling me that with all the Empire's knowledge at our disposal, we can't work a few pieces of machinery?
It can't be that hard.
Work it, yes. But we don't have the manpower or the experience to be delicate, and according to Nadrin....
Improper application of the lasers runs a high risk of destroying Makeb immediately.
Best option is to recruit the best and brightest of the locals, but that's going to get tricky. Watch:
This is the Archon to Phobium Squad Command.
The Imperial forces are desperate, and I believe they intend to mine what isotope-5 they can before the core erupts.
But the Imperials will need assistance. Have your men place all engineers of level seven and above under protective custody.
He's wrong about our goal, but it doesn't matter. The Archon's got black-ops mercs kidnapping the people we need.
If they're still alive, they can still be made ours. Give me everything you know.
We'll kidnap them back.
It saves us the trouble of finding those workers ourselves. Now we just need to follow the mercenaries.
That could be convenient.
This Hutt isn't going to leave us alone. We need to deal with him, and soon.
The Archon is a problem.
I'll see what more I can dig up on him. Meanwhile, we know where the workers are being held.
Phobium Squad is an off-the-books team of Regulator mercenaries: assassins the Hutts bought out with cybernetics. They're holding the workers in groundquake shelters.
A few engineering chiefs who escaped joined a Republic refugee caravan. Won't be long before Phobium Squad catches them, too.
I'll see to the caravan and the groundquake shelters. Anything else?
Let's get to it, then.
You said Phobium Squad was paid off in cybernetics?
Tell me more about the enemy.
Cybernetics, stims, all the latest from Nar Shaddaa. They could buy slave colonies on their salaries, but this is tech not on the market.
I don't often get to save civilians from their oppressors. This should be interesting.
Rescuing people... how novel.
One more thing: We're still decrypting the order, but it looks like the Archon sent an isotope-5 droid to help secure the caravan. Just to make things difficult.
I'll stay in touch from here. Anything you need, let us know.
Is the inductor fully charged?
One hundred percent and holding. Ready when you are.
The radiation pulse from Makeb's core should be harmless; however, you may wish to shield your eyes.
Receiving data. Mapping locations of isotope-5 deposits.
Nadrin? What is that?
Unexpected. The pulse has caused a minute shift in isotope-5 energy levels; a minor groundquake is imminent.
Minor or not, I'm kilometers below the surface. Any tremor could bury me alive.
This place could collapse.
How did I know this operation couldn't run smoothly? Suggestions, anyone?
I wish I could be surprised.
You assured me there was no danger.
You stupid creature. [Choke him]
Forgiveness, please....
Under my command, failure and treason are one and the same. I will remember this.
You will pay.
There is no room for error in your calculations, Nadrin. And I don't have room for fools on my team.
You've failed me badly.
If I weren't down here about to be buried, I'd shoot you.
You stupid creature.
We humbly beg forgiveness and acknowledge our many flaws!
You need as much distance as possible. There's an emergency shelter near the cavern entrance--go!
Ground team to support. We're in position.
Acknowledged. Signal when you've unloaded the equipment.
This is Nadrin. All systems functioning within acceptable parameters.
Please be advised that the primary inductor array will take several minutes to fully charge.
Keep checking its status. I'll buy us whatever time we need.
I'll handle it.
We will await your command.
Those creatures seem to be attracted to the equipment. It could be a problem.
We may not have that long.
Apologies. That is... unexpected. We will await your next command.
Take your time. Something just came up to keep me... entertained.
Time for fun. [Disconnect]
Well? Come and take me.
Ground to support team. There's something blocking my way--the mine shaft is capped.
Checking the blueprints. Capping is standard practice when a site is shut down.... There should be another route.
All right. Sending details. Head on in and get ready to run the experiment.
Support team, do you read? I've arrived at the drill shaft.
Position confirmed.
You have, perhaps, reached a maintenance station? The accompanying mine shaft should lead nearly to the planet's core.
Once you are deep enough, you might induce the core's isotope-5 deposits to release a radiation burst. That would allow us to determine the core's status.
I was there for the briefing. I'll begin descent shortly.
I know the mission.
Are you making progress? Are we on track to stabilize Makeb before it explodes?
How's your research coming?
The Science Bureau is pursuing three lines of inquiry. I am coordinating, and I am hopeful that at least one stabilization technique will prove sound.
Unfortunately, without a test planet, final results are unpredictable.
You really believe that unleashing Makeb's energy will prove harmless?
That still seems dangerous.
The theory seems sound. I may be mistaken.
I've been going through the mine site blueprints--I'll copy you on the data--and it looks like the machinery is offline.
You'll want to flip the backup generators, get power to the turbolifts and locks. But there are... life-forms down there. Big ones.
I have the means to defend myself. We'll speak when I reach the bottom.
I plan to stay alert.
Acknowledged. Support team out.
Are we talking about wildlife? Something native to Makeb?
What sort of life-forms?
Reports say the deep drilling caused an... infestation of some kind. Why the rig was abandoned, I think.
Could be relatives of those creatures in the caves around Stronghold One. Be on the lookout, anyway. Support team out.
In the caves around Stronghold One, there were creatures that sought me out. They died.
I've fought the fauna before.
Might be the same thing here, but on a larger scale. Reports say the deep drilling caused an... infestation.
Be on the lookout, anyway. Support team out.
We're doing everything we can.
You've got an army to fight. Let's save the world.
You should hurry. If the mercenaries start executing engineers, we're out of luck.
